channel.title: workstation-->gateway-->gateway
channel.description: Hello. I wondered if it is possible to connect two gateways with each other so that the traffic from the workstation goes first to the first gateway, and then to the second one? Theoretically, with this scheme, compromising the first gateway will not show our real ip address, since it will be hidden behind the second gateway. Is such a scheme even real? And what are its pros and cons. The question is still being discussed on the default whonix on virtualbox, but it would be interesting to try on qubes. communicate via google translator :smiley:

item.title: workstation-->gateway-->gateway

item.description:
Hello. I wondered if it is possible to connect two gateways with each other so that the traffic from the workstation goes first to the first gateway, and then to the second one? Theoretically, with this scheme, compromising the first gateway will not show our real ip address, since it will be hidden behind the second gateway. Is such a scheme even real? And what are its pros and cons. The question is still being discussed on the default whonix on virtualbox, but it would be interesting to try on qubes. communicate via google translator
